source_note: State baseline derived from Indiana Department of Environmental Management (IDEM) recycling programs and city rules.

organics.guidance: Composting regulated by IDEM; residents encouraged to compost yard and food waste.
organics.bin: Green/yard waste cart or compost drop-off.
organics.notes: Indianapolis and Bloomington have limited composting programs.
provenance: IDEM Solid Waste and Composting Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean, dry paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.notes: Greasy or waxed materials not accepted.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or drop-off site.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum, steel, and tin cans; empty and rinse.
metal_containers.notes: Do not include scrap metal or pressurized containers.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1â€“#2; local programs vary for others.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Indiana has no container deposit law.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle via curbside or drop-off program.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through HHW programs.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste recycling available through IDEM-registered facilities; TVs banned from landfills.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.

bulky_items.guidance: Arrange pickup or bring bulky items to landfill or transfer station.
